name: Commonwealth, Appellant, v. Danville Bessemer Company

judges: Before Mitchell, Dean, Fell, Blown and Pot-tee, JJ.
parties: Commonwealth, Appellant, v. Danville Bessemer Company.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
Judgment affirmed on opinion of the court below in Com. v. American Car and Foundry Company, ante, p. 302.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Frederic W. Fleitz, deputy attorney general, and John P. Flkin, attorney general, for appellant.
M. F. Olmsted, with him A. Q. Stamm, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth, Appellant, v. Danville Bessemer Company.
Argued June 3, 1902.
Appeal, No. 18, May T., 1902, by plaintiff, from judgment of C. P. Dauphin Co., Commonwealth Docket, 1901, No. 200, for defendant, on appeal from tax settlement in case of Commonwealth v. Danville Bessemer Company.
Before Mitchell, Dean, Fell, Blown and Pot-tee, JJ.
Affirmed.
Frederic W. Fleitz, deputy attorney general, and John P. Flkin, attorney general, for appellant.
M. F. Olmsted, with him A. Q. Stamm, for appellee.
June 3, 1902:
